document.title: Georgia Department of Education Information Technology Career Cluster Introduction to Software Technology Course Number 11.44600

FF0DE1FE9B53460D9A7718D5E2947E58.description:
Explore the competitive events related to the content of this course and the required
competencies, skills, and knowledge for each related event for individual, team, and chapter competitions.

32233CFCB274410E83FF9CD9D355AC17.description: Explain how participation in career and technology education student organizations can promote lifelong responsibility for community service and professional development.

25FE2954F8814545A72A0904E72ED57F.description: Explore the local, state, and national opportunities available to students through participation in related student organizations (FBLA, TSA, SkillsUSA) including but not limited to conferences, competitions, community service, philanthropy, and other student organization activities.

BD2AB0AF592E493EB8C86822E2B0A084.description: Explore the impact and opportunities a student organization (FBLA, TSA, SkillsUSA) can develop to bring business and education together in a positive working relationship through innovative leadership and career development programs.

8641C3CACD834CC98FECD56E33E1E585.description: Explain the goals, mission, and objectives of Future Business Leaders of America (FBLA) and/or Technology Student Association (TSA) and/or SkillsUSA.

84CA39F7A381428BB741FD715A5F4EA3.description: Explore how related student organizations are integral parts of career and technology education courses through leadership development, school and community service projects, entrepreneurship development, and competitive events.

EBCA86D6BE0C4EDDB0A25A0D66948DDA.description:
Describe personal and legal consequences of inappropriate use of resources and online
content, including but not limited to plagiarism, piracy, illegal downloading, copyright infringement, licensing infringement, and inappropriate use of software, hardware, and mobile devices.

998F8860196C419ABD0F4BE8FEAE7C14.description: Describe the various copyright licenses used in the creation and distribution of software.

EBBE66C0E4B04B2B87E3A309AEE4F9CB.description: Debate laws and regulations that impact the development and use of software.

EBBEDA99685047DAA34C189A6CF1CFA1.description: Exercise digital citizenship as a lifelong learner.

0D89A60461DC4107BA1ED3FE3938ECA9.description: Evaluate the ways computing impacts personal, ethical, social, economic, and cultural practices.

07E47FF043E84098968E58F7B1684431.description: Demonstrate positive cyber citizenry by applying industry-accepted ethical practices and behaviors.

AA4263907B224D69BD080E661BBFF7F1.description: Describe, analyze, develop, and follow policies for managing ethical and legal issues in the business world and in a technology-based society.

E5ACEE42CA3B42DEAFDCD5710151158F.description:
Understand how data from an external source such as a file, database, or stream can be
input, manipulated, and output in programs.

5485040CE99E4D818F42D824C9EA1669.description:
Create and access libraries and Application Programming Interfaces (APIs) in the
development of programs or applications. Upload to online career portfolio.

67D5BD4983DD46BD81CDFC7F28433F76.description:
Demonstrate the use of content-management systems to track changes and allow for
multiple people to create, edit and modify source code files.

93716F01D10D452AA5A728186D1D8B68.description:
Demonstrate the use of pair-programming in the development of new programs and
applications.

D8DEEA0BE4C64F619B7F0A1722EC01DC.description:
Explore text-editors and Integrated Development Environments (IDEs) in the use of
software development for different software and hardware platforms.

A3F48D0F397042439A3C543EE783F0A9.description: Use various debugging and testing methods to ensure program correctness.

F1676DA5B5424FBE8A25A4FBE648EE8D.description: Design, develop, test, and implement programs using high-level programming languages.

D22682CC45C74878811BF54988BBB51E.description:
Demonstrate the principles of readability and self-documenting code.
a. Use an appropriate naming convention in the creation of variables, functions and/or procedures.
b. Use comments to assist others in understanding programs, algorithms, and functions and/or procedures.

6A32936A5304492DB9E5314D6B3023A1.description: Explain how procedural abstraction is implemented to reuse code.

D166CA62741040299AC49279EF3D737D.description: Explain how sequence, selection, and iteration are building blocks of algorithms.

33BC37B1BCC8458094B720C82EA0D107.description: Describe a variety of programming languages used to solve problems.

DE76B5E05A164D6CBE9C4146DD7ACF30.description: Explain and apply the procedures used in current programming languages to access code libraries, scripts, and related coding principles.

81E569B448BB4A31822BFFF467BA931F.description: Identify and explain the building blocks, principles, and ways to access code within programming languages used today.

68552E95BB7C4B3EB1C0A310B4E47883.description: Explore the trends and emerging issues for websites.

3EA709154EAB4C4EB1D645665BFB72B5.description: Explain the impact of mobile sites on the development of business.

3FAD69845459413DA40B017481D22908.description: Explain site accessibility in relation to standards, rules and laws including Web Accessibility Initiative (WAI) and Web Content Accessibility Guides (WCAG).

103BFA130E324B4A9E50A2FB5D1C2571.description:
Design simple and dynamic webpages incorporating HTML5 elements (e.g., text, audio,
video, and canvas elements such as SVG and other graphics), navigation, linking, forms and client-side scripting. Upload to online career portfolio.

CD07B0BB94054856B27E298D4363C797.description:
Understand the Document Object Model (DOM) used in web page organization and in the
creation of dynamic web pages.

D93E44216A6B47A3A2238ADB8126EA68.description: Describe how HTML5 and CSS3 are living web standards.

BCCECCB1850D4AFEB73169D2B09109CE.description: Understand elements of web design, including HTML5, CSS3, responsive design, site usability and accessibility, relation of site to business, and story the site reveals about the business.

9B2A20514D71407794D7ABF6917C0E29.description: Understand and apply design principles to create professional appearing and functioning web pages.

0FB8B115FFE9405499B06C239B80AC37.description: Create and organize webpages through the use of a variety of web programming design tools.

FC5ADDE42CA64A8C982A95FBA4B1C454.description:
Create a table showing the most prevalent programming languages currently being used
and determine industry tasks where each would be best utilized. Upload to online career portfolio.

FB39DBE4D38C48938CB00DD20A6627B7.description:
Explore commonly used documentation tools for design specifications, such as flowcharts,
pseudocode, visual and textual storyboards.

30BB38B552644A7397F3699DD71B3AF0.description:
Explain the differences between various software development models such as the
iterative and incremental model, scrum, and waterfall.

12220855A1E04322A8596445DFEC1CD0.description: Explain the software development process to solve problems.

8A025623227C4896A97202BD79A33750.description: Use computational thinking procedures to analyze and solve problems.

0165B898CE964E6E8B12D30D9526C636.description:
Identify and explain how to protect Personally Identifiable Information (PII) in a digital
world (Refer to FERPA guidelines).

6F57F4624D4246D79FB47C2213C22D65.description:
Define and demonstrate folder and file management and the importance of content-
management systems.

9ADCE630C5A94032A4E47E4132428C62.description:
Recognize online risks and dangers in order to take appropriate actions to protect the
business and self while using digital tools and resources.

2509CD996A144993A4C5EF1EB77E6D75.description:
Describe trends in emerging, evolving, and future computer technologies and their
influence on IT practices, such as mobile technology, cloud computing, and
microcontrollers.

C450B5B7DC9848F0B5524BDA8C014F4A.description: Develop a working IT vocabulary specific to software and programming.

F5EF1E4EE71E4CA5AB86D9E769824430.description: Understand, communicate, and adapt to a digital world.

2D5D6544670B41E8BE42CAB8511911B5.description: Explain the function and purpose of software tools, text editors, Integrated Development Environments (IDEs), and software development toolchains.

FC1302B01F144F28BE882CDCFE0650C2.description: Describe and explore current and emerging software, including operating systems, application software, and applications for software development.

9A9758724D99467AB8836241B77C011D.description: Identify input and output devices and ports, including keyboards, monitors, printers, touch screens, mice, peripheral connectors (e.g., USB, Lightning, HDMI, and emerging technologies), microcontrollers and sensors (e.g., GPS, temperature, accelerometer).

E8CAD5C31BC947659701980EE3A99739.description: Demonstrate understanding of set up of a basic computer workstation.

E0F89829E5CE47F7B3FFBCB754B10E24.description: Identify, describe, evaluate, and use appropriate technology for given situations.

BEF8632467574287A03A8F919674E91E.description: Create a communication document utilizing advanced word processing, spreadsheet, presentation, electronic mail, and database script and app tools for business.

8FD3B25DF12B46A4952E5BD806C3223E.description: Identify effective database strategies and create a database to maintain a customer list. Upload to online career portfolio.

B60A988ECD4E46CF8E3DB8DF4CDE310F.description:
Demonstrate ability to assist all audiences in a professional manner.
a. Actively listen to your audience to determine individual needs, such as specifications for a design, breaking down the specifications, and communicating to non-technical individuals. b. Ensure that your assistance promotes the best interests of the company.

506AE7E65003490B8607B37CA5DB261B.description:
Apply strategies for identifying routine software problems current to everyday life.
a. Compose an appropriate report outlining procedures to correct an identified software
problem. Upload to online career portfolio.

29D29D1533AF4DCF9AF8280DAF430539.description: Explain the impact of emerging technologies on a business and how it affects the bottom line.

18C6934910914559B15E3D6A709F30A8.description: Differentiate between the different audiences of a business, including users, clients, customers, contractors, vendors, and others.

843525DDE4B04849A6F341AC477EEAA1.description: Demonstrate effective professional communication skills (oral, written, and digital) and practices that enable positive relationships with all audiences of a business.

2BF3EAFDD506466FA8F4ED12DE3C658C.description:
Research specific IT careers, including post-secondary continuing education options, IT
credentials, required job skills, potential salaries in Georgia, and work environment. Upload to online career portfolio.

F2C1863ADD304F72873D69864C1D71A3.description:
Use collaborative tools to communicate with team members, such as online meeting platforms,
group messaging, and shared online documents and files.

47C139EC70E248F0A03CE138E5BBEF36.description: Develop technical reading and writing skills to follow instructions.

CF90296741564D548EF84D8548229A68.description: Explore, research, and present findings on positions and career paths in technology and the impact of technology on chosen career area.

7CA2E5EEDA994371AB785EE147B006C3.description: Organize the portfolio in a manner that makes documents and artifacts easy to locate and access for review.

36D5178F8614496BB0F5235843562515.description: Identify and upload industry-appropriate artifacts reflective of mastered skills throughout this course. Write and include a reflective entry for each artifact discussing steps taken, problems encountered and how they were overcome, and other pertinent information about the learning.

653A0A74D2C9487CA39A474D2DF67DAA.description: Upload additional standard job search items, such as digital badges and certificates earned for industry-recognized credentials.

7AC2F3A89AEC4D9DBD3903986838E8DF.description: Upload a professional, true, and accurate résumé and cover letter seeking employment for a position representative of current skills and knowledge.

5B23A30DFC7A4BAB85DEBFE6320F0EA6.description: Establish an account for long-term use to upload professional artifacts over the course of the career pathway.

513C32C3CF54444FBECC4EBE7D612E6C.description: Compare a variety of secure online repositories and select the best one for specific career goals, such as Github for education, Dropbox, Jimdo, Uxfol.io, Portfoliobox and many others.

F912C32CD32C41F8BF25425AC0078B98.description: Establish a personal online career portfolio and begin uploading relevant artifacts.

515D4940A90548599041EC0A9CD80F59.description: Present a professional image through appearance, behavior, and language.

6659FA476D4F4FA7B53380205F60A58C.description: Apply the appropriate skill sets to be productive in a changing, technological, diverse workplace to be able to work independently and apply teamwork skills.

613457EAB6EC4035987F2AC10243403C.description: Model work readiness traits required for success in the workplace including integrity, honesty, accountability, punctuality, time management, and respect for diversity.

EB2DB4B7F2FE44E0B93BE7FC6380E03B.description: Exhibit critical thinking and problem-solving skills to locate, analyze and apply information in career planning and employment situations.

51FC5A12FAFC4F15BB71D35B905DEFB0.description: Demonstrate creativity by asking challenging questions and applying innovative procedures and methods.

3B02E59CFB694580BD8304C97BDAD9CA.description: Communicate effectively through writing, speaking, listening, reading, and interpersonal abilities.

7DB95923A8FA4B698FE4C4C3BBE3598E.description: Demonstrate employability skills required by business and industry.
